column11: This word is frequently used in Chinese media to refer to positive and uplifting themes, especially those that align with socialist values, patriotism, or national pride.  It's often translated as "main theme" or "mainstream melody," but its usage carries a distinct ideological connotation in China.--------This word is literally translated as "main melody". It is used metaphorically to refer to the dominant theme or ideology promoted by the government or other authorities.  It often carries a positive connotation, suggesting a harmonious and unified message.  Think of it as the "official line" or "party line."  It can also be used more broadly to describe the main theme of any event or situation.
